snippet: Restrictions on the flow of capital have given some Cypriots the feeling that not all euros are created equal, raising a crucial question: Is the euro zone already starting to break up?
abstract: Restrictions on flow of capital in Cyprus as part of country's bailout plan has given some Cypriots feeling that not all euros are created equal; rules and paperwork involved in transferring money add to cost of many transactions, effectively reducing value of the currency in Cyprus compared with rest of euro zone; most banks in Cyprus have stopped issuing loans altogether because their interest rates are much higher than their neighbors like Germany.

byline.contributor: Dimitris Bounias contributed reporting from Nicosia, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: Restrictions on the flow of capital have given some Cypriots the feeling that not all euros are created equal, raising a crucial question: Is the euro zone already starting to break up?

headline.main: Currency Controls in Cyprus Increase Worry About Euro System
headline.print_headline: Cyprus Controls Increase Worry On Euro System
